name: places/ChIJ064AVwtZwokRK_IbyKmCNBQ
formattedAddress: 284 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 284 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA

originalText.text: Love this cute coffee place. I went on a windy winter day so it was a bit crowded. The latte was so good! As a coffee nerd, I can attest to that they used freshly ground coffee to make the lattes. The service was 10/10. They had surprisingly a good amount of seating for a NY cafe. The cardamom bun was yummy. It didn’t have a very strong cardamom taste and it wasn’t too sweet. Def check out this place!

text.text: Love this cute coffee place. I went on a windy winter day so it was a bit crowded. The latte was so good! As a coffee nerd, I can attest to that they used freshly ground coffee to make the lattes. The service was 10/10. They had surprisingly a good amount of seating for a NY cafe. The cardamom bun was yummy. It didn’t have a very strong cardamom taste and it wasn’t too sweet. Def check out this place!

originalText.text:
Stumbled upon this place on a Saturday afternoon, it had a small line outside so was pretty busy. Was told if you don't get there earlier, a lot of their pastries will be sold out! Thankfully that wasn't the case when we went, they were pretty full.

We got two croissants and a pumpkin tart. The croissants were good, they have a nice light, buttery flavor on the inside, with a harder exterior. (warning: can get a bit messy)
The pumpkin tart was really interesting, on the outside it's a picture perfect decorated glaze, but on the inside there was a cranberry layer. I was surprised with how strong of a flavor it was, it still tasted good! Just not what I had envisioned when I get a pumpkin tart. Either way, if you're looking for a small bite, coming here is a pleasant experience.

originalText.text: Excellent tea, coffee, service, and ambiance. We also bought the pumpkin pie tart and cardamom tart. Both were excellent. They don’t allow laptops in the space so don’t plan on doing electronic work. We also bought an expresso flight which was absolutely delicious. The service was impeccable.

text.text: Excellent tea, coffee, service, and ambiance. We also bought the pumpkin pie tart and cardamom tart. Both were excellent. They don’t allow laptops in the space so don’t plan on doing electronic work. We also bought an expresso flight which was absolutely delicious. The service was impeccable.

originalText.text: I had read about how good of a coffee place this place was, and the reviews were spot on. If you are looking for high end natural process and washed process single origins, this is your spot. The coffee quality is similar to Merriweather on Hudson in the West Village. The only thing I’d change is they would offer the various Ethiopians as espresso drinks also and not just for pour overs, but I understand. I will be back.

text.text: I had read about how good of a coffee place this place was, and the reviews were spot on. If you are looking for high end natural process and washed process single origins, this is your spot. The coffee quality is similar to Merriweather on Hudson in the West Village. The only thing I’d change is they would offer the various Ethiopians as espresso drinks also and not just for pour overs, but I understand. I will be back.

originalText.text:
That zen energy and minimalist look greeted me and my companions as soon as we walked in. I felt like i got transported to a nice and calm place in Japan for a moment lol The place was already getting busy but the atmosphere especially the tranquil music that played in the cafe just puts you in a calm vibe. i was pleasantly surprised to have such an impression just with that alone - that got me excited to get a full experience as soon as we stepped inside.

The baked good looked very appetizing that we tried a bunch of them. The cardamom bun seemed popular but I guess it just had an aftertaste for me that I didnt quite enjoy. Im glad it wasnt too overpowering though. My favorite would be their pain suisse - buttery but flaky with some crunch as you bite into it and had very nice dark chocolate filling. The canneles were very good as well!

Coffees were delicious and fresh; very good balance of milk and espresso for the lattes and of course the latte art was nicely done. Hot coco was delicious too! We got to talk to some of the staff and they were just wonderful as well.

we overall had a great time and a wonderful unique experience here. Definitely one of the best cafes we’ve tried and would sure love to come back soon.
